revised_title: On the Nature and Limits of Reptilian Character in Mammalian Teeth
tldr: The author examines the similarities and differences between mammalian and reptilian teeth, focusing on the presence of multiple roots, implantation in bony sockets, differentiation of tooth types, and cusp development. The study suggests that these characteristics are not exclusive to the mammalian class and can be found in some reptiles, indicating a possible correlation with food and environmental factors.
